duties_responsibilities.duty: Ensure all client needs are promptly and accurately addressed; answer telephone calls and resolve client queries.
Review and respond to electronic correspondence; address issues and concerns with professionalism and attention to resolution.
Prepare deposits, scan incoming checks, process receipt of physical security certificates, and maintain Time Stamp log.
Create and close accounts; add power of attorney and trading authority as applicable, and complete client registrations.
Interact directly with customers, demonstrating a genuine interest in serving and caring for clients.
Develop and execute strategies to enhance client experience and improve operational support to the firm.
Complete client registrations and proactively address and follow-through on client service requests.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's or Associates degree preferred with 5+ years of Brokerage and Client Services experience, or equivalent demonstrated through a combination of work experience, training, and/or education.
